abstract: Opponents of Turkey’s Pres Recep Tayyip blame him for stalling formation of new coalition government after June 2015 elections,given fact that he has yet to issue formal mandate to leader of any party; critics accuse Tayyip of deliberately stalling in order to keep his party’s grip on power, undermine rivals and push for another election.
lead_paragraph: Critics say President Recep Tayyip Erdogan has been stalling the process to maintain his party’s grip on power, undermine his opponents and push the country toward snap elections.

headline.main: President Erdogan Is Accused of Stalling as Turks Await a Government
headline.print_headline: President Is Accused of Stalling as Turks Await a Government

snippet: Critics say President Recep Tayyip Erdogan has been stalling the process to maintain his party’s grip on power, undermine his opponents and push the country toward snap elections.
